title: Will Intel reduce its workforce by at least 14% by August, 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if Intel confirms a reduction of at least 14% of its total workforce by August 31, 2024. The reduction must be officially announced or reported in Intel's financial statements or press releases. If the reduction is less than 14% or not confirmed by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

title: Will Intel's stock price increase by more than 20% from its October 1, 2023 closing price by August, 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if Intel's stock price on any trading day before or on August 31, 2024, closes at a price that is more than 20% higher than its closing price on October 1, 2023. The stock prices will be based on the primary listing exchange for Intel's shares. If the stock price does not reach this threshold by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

title: Will a musical gala honoring a former U.S. president's 100th birthday take place at a historic theater in Atlanta by August, 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if a musical gala honoring a former U.S. president's 100th birthday occurs at a historic theater in Atlanta by August 31, 2024. The event must be publicly reported by at least two major news outlets. If the event is canceled, postponed beyond the resolution date, or does not take place as described, the question resolves as NO.

article_information.article_description: Former President Jimmy Carter will be honored next month ahead of his 100th birthday with a musical gala at Atlanta's Fox Theatre. body: This question resolves as YES if a major cultural institution in Atlanta hosts a birthday tribute for a notable political figure aged 99 or older by August 31, 2024. The event must be confirmed by official sources and reported by reputable news organizations. If no such event takes place, or if it occurs outside of Atlanta, the question resolves as NO.

title: Will India's loan offer to Vietnam for maritime security exceed $300 million by August, 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if India increases its loan offer to Vietnam for maritime security purposes to an amount greater than $300 million by August 31, 2024. The increase must be officially announced by the Indian government or reported by at least two reputable international news sources. If no increase is announced or the loan amount remains at or below $300 million, the question resolves as NO.

title: Will a political marketing company be fined over $50,000 for campaign-related violations in the United States by August, 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if a political marketing company operating in the United States is fined more than $50,000 for violations related to campaign materials or activities by August 31, 2024. The fine must be imposed by a state or federal authority and publicly reported by at least two reputable news sources. The violation must be directly related to campaign activities, such as the design or distribution of campaign materials. If no such fine is reported or if the highest reported fine is $50,000 or less, the question will resolve as NO.

title: Will a state attorney general's office announce legal action against a marketing firm for election-related violations by August, 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a state attorney general's office in the United States publicly announces legal action against a marketing firm for violations related to election materials or activities. The announcement must be made through official channels and reported by at least two reputable news sources. Legal action includes filing lawsuits, issuing cease and desist orders, or imposing fines. If no such announcement is made, or if the announcements are made by entities other than a state attorney general's office, the question resolves as NO.

title: Will a marketing company agree to pay a fine exceeding $30,000 for violating state election laws by August, 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a marketing company agrees to pay a fine greater than $30,000 for violating state election laws in any U.S. state. The agreement must be publicly reported by at least two reputable news sources and confirmed by the relevant state authority. The violation must be directly related to election laws, such as improper design or distribution of election-related materials. If no such agreement is reported, or if the highest reported fine agreement is $30,000 or less, the question resolves as NO.

title: Will an appeal be filed against the sentencing of an inmate involved in a high-profile prison killing by August, 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if an appeal is filed against the sentencing of Paul J. DeCologero, who was sentenced to more than four years for his role in the 2018 fatal bludgeoning of James 'Whitey' Bulger in a West Virginia prison. The appeal must be formally submitted to a higher court and acknowledged by the court system. The question resolves as NO if no such appeal is filed or officially recorded by August 31, 2024.

title: Will a major US-Russia prisoner exchange occur by August, 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the United States and Russia conduct a prisoner exchange involving at least three individuals from each country. The exchange must be officially confirmed by government representatives from both nations or reported by at least two reputable international news organizations. The question will resolve as NO if no such exchange occurs within the specified timeframe or if the exchange involves fewer than three individuals from either side.

title: Will an American journalist be released from detention in Russia by August, 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, an American journalist who was detained in Russia is released and allowed to return to the United States. The release must be officially confirmed by the U.S. government or reported by at least two reputable international news organizations. The question will resolve as NO if no such release occurs within the specified timeframe or if the released individual is not a journalist.

title: Will a US corporate executive detained abroad be freed by August, 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a United States citizen who holds or held an executive position in a corporation and was detained in a foreign country is released and allowed to return to the United States. The release must be officially confirmed by the U.S. government or reported by at least two reputable international news organizations. The question will resolve as NO if no such release occurs within the specified timeframe or if the released individual does not meet the criteria of being a corporate executive.

title: Will weekly U.S. jobless claims exceed 300,000 by August, 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if the U.S. Department of Labor reports that initial jobless claims for any single week exceed 300,000 by August 31, 2024. The figure must be reported in the official weekly release and not be subsequently revised below 300,000. If no such report is made, or if the highest reported weekly figure remains below 300,000, the question will resolve as NO.

title: Will the U.S. unemployment rate rise above 4.5% by August, 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if the U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics reports a monthly unemployment rate exceeding 4.5% for any month up to and including August 2024. The rate must be reported in the official monthly jobs report and not be subsequently revised below 4.5%. If no such report is made, or if the highest reported monthly unemployment rate remains at or below 4.5%, the question resolves as NO.

title: Will a major U.S. company announce layoffs affecting over 10,000 employees by August, 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if a publicly traded U.S. company listed on the S&P 500 index announces layoffs affecting more than 10,000 employees in a single announcement by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be made through official company channels or reported by at least two major news outlets. If no such announcement is made, or if the largest announced layoff affects 10,000 or fewer employees, the question resolves as NO.

title: Will a rule banning airlines from charging extra for children to sit with parents be implemented by August, 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a rule is officially implemented that prohibits airlines from charging additional fees for children aged 13 or younger to be seated next to their parents or guardians on flights. The rule must apply to both U.S. and foreign carriers operating in the United States. The question resolves as NO if such a rule is not implemented by the specified date.

title: Will there be significant public opposition to a proposed airline seating rule for families by August, 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there is substantial public opposition to a proposed rule regarding airline seating for families. Significant opposition would be indicated by at least 10,000 public comments against the proposal submitted to the Department of Transportation, or by a major airline industry group publicly opposing the rule. The question resolves as NO if there is no such significant opposition by the specified date.

body: This question resolves as YES if credible news sources report nationwide protests in Nigeria involving more than 10,000 participants in total across multiple cities by August 31, 2024. The protests must be related to economic issues or government policies. For resolution, at least two reputable international news organizations must report on the scale of the protests.

title: Will NHTSA issue new regulations for automated driving systems by August, 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) issues new regulations specifically addressing automated driving systems in vehicles by August 31, 2024. The regulations must be officially announced and published by NHTSA. This does not include proposed rules or draft regulations that have not been formally adopted.

title: Will a major automaker suspend its automated driving system program by August, 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if any automaker among the top 10 global manufacturers by sales volume announces a suspension or discontinuation of their automated driving system program by August 31, 2024. The suspension must be company-wide and affect all vehicles with such systems. Temporary pauses for updates or limited recalls do not count as a suspension.
